wcGeneSummary 0.99.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • wcGeneSummary

    wcGeneSummary

    wcGeneSummary.Rd

    Plot wordcloud of RefSeq description obtained by GeneSummary

    wcGeneSummary(
  geneList,
  keyType = "SYMBOL",
  excludeFreq = 5000,
  additionalRemove = NA,
  madeUpper = c("dna", "rna"),
  organism = 9606,
  palette = c("blue", "red"),
  numWords = 15,
  scaleRange = c(5, 10),
  showLegend = FALSE,
  orgDb = org.Hs.eg.db,
  edgeLabel = FALSE,
  ngram = NA,
  plotType = "wc",
  colorText = FALSE,
  corThresh = 0.6,
  layout = "nicely",
  edgeLink = TRUE,
  deleteZeroDeg = TRUE,
  enrich = NULL,
  topPath = 10,
  ora = FALSE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    geneList

    ENTREZID list

    keyType

    default to SYMBOL

    excludeFreq

    exclude words with overall frequency above excludeFreq default to 5000

    additionalRemove

    specific words to be excluded

    madeUpper

    make the words uppercase in resulting plot

    organism

    organism ID to use

    palette

    palette for color gradient in correlation network

    numWords

    the number of words to be shown

    scaleRange

    scale for label and node size in correlation network

    showLegend

    whether to show legend in correlation network

    orgDb

    default to org.Hs.eg.db

    edgeLabel

    if TRUE, plot the edge label (default: FALSE)

    ngram

    default to NA (1)

    plotType

    "wc" or "network"

    colorText

    color text label based on frequency in correlation network

    corThresh

    the correlation threshold

    layout

    the layout for correlation network, defaul to "nicely"

    edgeLink

    if FALSE, use geom_edge_diagonal

    deleteZeroDeg

    delete zero degree node from plot in correlation network

    enrich

    currently, only 'reactome' and 'kegg' is supported

    topPath

    how many pathway descriptions are included in text analysis

    ora

    perform ora or not (experimental)

    ...

    parameters to pass to wordcloud()

    Value

    list of data frame and ggplot2 object

    Examples

    geneList <- c("DDX41")
wcGeneSummary(geneList)
#> Input genes: 1
